content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

Here is an example of how you can implement the `show` function in Julia:

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits{T<:Real}
    value::T
    unit::String
end

function Base.show(io::IO, x::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, x.value, " ", x.unit)
end
```
This `show` function takes an I/O stream (`io`) and a `FloatWithUnits` object (`x`). It then prints the value of the FloatWithUnits object followed by a space and the unit.

You can test this function with:

```julia
julia> fwu = FloatWithUnits(1.8, "meters")
1.8 meters
```
